Not enough games available for meaningfu: Pas assez de parties pour des données intéressantes.
Select a composition to filter the Minio: Select a composition to filter the Minion Guide, Tavern Up and Hero Power charts.
Popularity of this composition is too lo: Popularity of this composition is too low for this hero.
Percent of the time this hero is picked: Percent of the time this hero is picked at the start of a game when presented as an option.
The final placement this hero achieves o: The final placement this hero achieves on average. Lower is better.
Each bar represents a final placement fr: Each bar represents a final placement from 1st to 8th and how often this hero finishes a game at that placement.
Most first place players have a normal c: Most first place players have a normal copy of the minion on their board at the end of the game.
Most first place players have a tripled: Most first place players have a tripled copy of the minion on their board at the end of the game.
Most first place players purchase at lea: Most first place players purchase at least one copy of the minion by the end of the tier.
Most first place players only purchase a: Most first place players only purchase an additional copy of the minion if they already have two copies.
Most first place players pick the minion: Most first place players pick the minion when offered as a triple reward.
Most first place players sell the minion: Most first place players sell the minion by the end of the tier.
Most first place players keep tripled co: Most first place players keep tripled copies of the minion, but sell normal ones by the end of the tier.
First place players frequently give the: First place players frequently give the minion taunt.
First place players frequently buy the m: First place players frequently buy the minion for it's buff and sell it after (if not Magnetic).
First place players frequently have two: First place players frequently have two copies of the minion on their board.
First place players often avoid tripling: First place players often avoid tripling the minion.
The minion has a positive impact on the: The minion has a positive impact on the outcome of combats.
The minion has a positive impact on outc: The minion has a positive impact on outcome of combat, but only if it is tripled.
Found no minions that match "<1></1>". Showing  similar .
Found no minions that match \"<1> or </1: Found no minions that match "<1> or </1>". Showing  similar .
Found no minions that match \"<1>, or <: Found no minions that match "<1>,  or </1>". Showing  similar .
Found no minions that match \"<1>, filte: Found no minions that match "<1>, filters[1]},  or </1>". Showing  similar .
Found no minions that match "<1>, filters[1]}, ,  or </1>". Showing  similar .
Detailed statistics about all minion, fo: Detailed statistics about all minion, for the selected hero, tier, turn and composition.
Compare multiple minions by adding a com: Compare multiple minions by adding a comma between each minion name:
Percent of the time players pick {minion: Percent of the time players pick {minion} as a triple reward when offered.
Percent of the time players who finish i: Percent of the time players who finish in first place purchase a first, second or third copy of {minion} when offered by Bob.
The difference in final placement betwee: The difference in final placement between players who played at least one copy of {minion} during Tier {tier} and players who played no copies of {minion} during Tier {tier}.
The difference in final placement between players who taunted at least one copy of {minion} during Tier {tier} and players who taunted no copies of {minion} during Tier {tier}.
Each bar represents a spot on the board. The height of each bar indicates how commonly {minion} is placed in that spot on the board.
The minions most commonly buffed by {min: The minions most commonly buffed by {minion}.
Percent of the time players who finish i: Percent of the time players who finish in first place have at least one copy of {minion} on the board during their last combat round at Tier {tier}.
The difference in combat winrate between: The difference in combat winrate between players who have a non-golden version of {minion} on board and all players at the selected tier, using the same hero and composition.
Percent of the time {minion} has been gi: Percent of the time {minion} has been given Taunt at this point in the game.
Most players tavern up for <0>{gold} gol: Most players tavern up for <0>{gold} gold</0>
Average placements within one standard d: Average placements within one standard deviation of the strongest hero
Average placements within one standard deviation below 4.5
Average placements more than one standar: Average placements more than one standard deviation below 4.5
Have you ever wondered what the stronges: Have you ever wondered what the strongest composition for your hero is?<1></1><2></2> This shows all compositions commonly played with the selected hero and let's you compare their performance and popularity. Selecting a composition will filter the data on this page to games played using that composition.
This is the average placement of all pla: This is the average placement of all players playing the selected hero achieve with this composition.
This is the percentage of all players us: This is the percentage of all players using this composition by the end of the game.
Clicking one of the compositions will se: Clicking one of the compositions will set that composition as active. When a composition is active the Tavern Up, Hero Power and Minion Guide will update to show data from players who were using that composition.
This shows an approximation of the avera: This shows an approximation of the average board state at the end of the selected Tavern Tier. When recruiting minions you can use this as a guide for what to build towards.
Minions are placed based on their most c: Minions are placed based on their most common board position and show their average attack and health. In this example, players on average have 2 Cobalt Guardian with 22 attack and 8 health.
If a minion is commonly tripled or buffe: If a minion is commonly tripled or buffed with Taunt or Divine Shield it will appear that way.
The live version of this uses data updat: The live version of this uses data updated every few hours based on uploaded player data
Filter all data to only include players: Filter all data to only include players who are in the top 50% or top 20%.
Select between data from the last 7 days: Select between data from the last 7 days and the latest Battlegrounds related Hearthstone patch or balance changes.
Do you need more fine grained control ov: Do you need more fine grained control over what data you see?
Have you ever wondered whether when you: Have you ever wondered whether when you should start or stop using your Hero Power?<1></1><2></2>This chart shows what percentage of first place player use their Hero Power on each turn.
The initial turns are indicated by the a: The initial turns are indicated by the amount of gold available at the start of each turn. 3 gold represents turn 1.
The turns after reaching 10 gold (i.e. 9: The turns after reaching 10 gold (i.e. 9 and onward) are indicated by "+1", "+2", etc.
In this example, none of the players use: In this example, none of the players use their Hero Power on turn 1. That means it's probably a bad idea to do so.
At turn 3 (indicated by 5 gold), about 8: At turn 3 (indicated by 5 gold), about 80% of players use their Hero Power. That means it's probably a good idea to do so.
Percent of the time the minion is purcha: Percent of the time the minion is purchased when offered to players who did not start the round with a copy of that minion on their board.
Percent of the time the minion is purchased when offered to players who had one copy of that minion on their board at the start of the round.
Percent of the time the minion is purchased when offered to players who had two copies of that minion on their board at the start of the round. Tripling is not always the best move!
Each bar represents a spot on the board. The height of each bar indicates how commonly the minion is placed in that spot on the board.
The difference in combat winrate between: The difference in combat winrate between players who have this minion on board and all players at the selected tier, using the same hero and composition. A negative value often indicates it's a good time sell.
Percent of the time this minion has been: Percent of the time this minion has been given Taunt at this point in the game.
The targets most commonly buffed by the: The targets most commonly buffed by the minion.
Have you ever wondered which minions to: Have you ever wondered which minions to buy, sell or where to place them on the board? These decisions can make all the difference!
This is how <1></1> performs at each tav: This is how <1></1> performs at each tavern tier
This is the Tavern Tier selector. Tier 1: This is the Tavern Tier selector. Tier 1 is currently active.
While at Tavern Tier 1 you can choose be: While at Tavern Tier 1 you can choose between data from only the first turn or all turns.
Unsure when to tavern up? Here you can s: Unsure when to tavern up? Here you can see that most players spend 4 gold to tavern up to Tier 3 with this hero.
This is the control panel used to change: This is the control panel used to change the active Tavern Tier. Changing this will update the Minion Guide to show data from players while they were at the active Tavern Tier.
Have you ever wondered whether you’re ta: Have you ever wondered whether you’re taverning up too soon or waiting too long?<1></1><2></2> This chart shows what tier the majority of winning players were at by the end of a given turn. Each color represents a different tier. The height of each bar corresponds to the percentage of winning players ending the turn at that tier.
For each color the number of bars indica: For each color the number of bars indicates how many turns the majority of players spend at a tier. In this example most players stay on Tavern Tier 2 for 3 turns.
100% of players are at tier 1 for the fi: 100% of players are at tier 1 for the first turn.
About 80% of players upgraded to Tavern: About 80% of players upgraded to Tavern Tier 2 on turn 2.
At 10 gold, most players are at Tavern T: At 10 gold, most players are at Tavern Tier 4, but 10% already upgraded to Tier 5.
Hovering a bar shows the full distributi: Hovering a bar shows the full distribution for that tier.
At turn 14 (indicated by +6) most player: At turn 14 (indicated by +6) most players are at Tavern Tier 5, but 10% of players are still at Tavern Tier 4.
Not enough data for Tavern Tier {tier}: Not enough data for Tavern Tier {tier}

Well Met! It looks like this is your {vi: Well Met! It looks like this is your {visitCount, selectordinal, one {#st} two {#nd} few {#rd} other{#th}} visit this month. Analyzing millions of replays each month requires a lot of server power. If you're getting value from HSReplay.net, then please consider supporting the site by subscribing to Premium! Here are just a couple of the great features you will gain access to:
Sign in or create a free HSReplay.net ac: Sign in or create a free HSReplay.net account to continue browsing the site in private mode.
The most accurate win rates as they chan: The most accurate win rates as they change day-by-day and hour-by-hour.
Statistics that are calculated based on: Statistics that are calculated based on your individual rank and region.
Mulligan guides specific to your opponen: Mulligan guides specific to your opponent's class and whether you have the coin.
HSReplay.net Premium enables loads of co: HSReplay.net Premium donne accès à de nombreuses fonctionnalités et filtres. Vous allez pouvoir améliorer votre style de jeu et aider le développement continu de HSReplay.net et Hearthstone Deck Tracker en même temps !
Time, rank and region filters: Filtres de période, de rang et de région
Tired of generic weekly snapshots? Find: Fatigué des aperçus hebdomadaires de la méta publiés sur d'autres sites ? Trouvez le meilleur deck à votre rang dans votre région grâce aux données les plus récentes.
What’s everyone playing at your rank? Se: Qu'est-ce qui est joué à votre rang ? Observez la popularité des différents archétypes à chaque rang.
Get an edge at the start of the game! Fi: Obtenez un avantage dès le début de la partie ! Trouver les meilleures cartes à garder contre l’archétype de votre adversaire.
See how all the cards in this deck are p: Observez l'efficacité des cartes de votre deck avec le winrate des cartes au mulligan, le nombre de tours gardées en main, et bien plus !
See all the decks you are currently play: Voir tous les decks que vous jouez actuellement et votre efficacité avec chacun d'entre eux !
Find out what cards are having the most: Découvrez quelles cartes ont le plus d’impact pendant vos parties ! Vérifiez si vos cartes ont l'efficacité attendue.
Figure out where a deck is favored! Get: Découvrez dans quels matchups un deck est favorable ! Accédez au tableau des matchups pour savoir quand un archétype est favorable dans la méta.
Deck Mulligan by Opponent Class: Mulligan du deck selon la classe de l'adversaire
Optimize your mulligans based on your op: Optimisez vos mulligans en fonction de votre adversaire ! Découvrez les meilleures cartes à garder pour augmenter vos chances de gagner.
Have you ever wondered when the best tim: Vous êtes-vous déjà demandé quel est le meilleur tour pour jouer Auspice Funeste ? Trouvez le tour où poser une carte vous donne le plus de chances de gagner.
